cottonBedroll: A soft and downy sleeping mattress, rolled up for ease of carrying. Can be used to sleep or rest very comfortably.
featherBedroll: A bedroll made with soft feathers and wrapped in fabric. Used for resting and sleeping in comfort.
rawTaintedMeat: A piece of bad-smelling meat, possibly diseased or tainted with parasites. Possible to consume, but could be deadly.
cookedTaintedMeat: A piece of discolored meat, cooked to kill possible toxins, but possibly still unsafe for consumption.
graniteKnife: A sharpened piece of granite acting as blade and socketed into a carved handle and wrapped with string for support. Can be used as a weapon, gathering tool or to carve.
rawBlindfish: An odd-looking fish with no eyes. Very slimy to the touch.
cookedBlindfish: While the source of the food is a bit suspect, after being cooked, it appears to be more palatable.
pemmican: A ball of dried ground meat. With a long shelf life, this is the ultimate survival food. For the best benefits, prepare it with animal fat.
cookedPemmican: A seasoned mound of dried ground meat, fried and cooked with fat for maximum flavor and caloric content.
sail: A large piece of fabric, woven together to be attached to a mast. Used on a sailboat to propel it along the sea.
sailboat: A large one-man boat. Used to traverse large expanses of water and for travel back to civilization.
chickenEgg: A brown colored egg, laid by a chicken. Can be eaten as is, or cooked for a tastier meal.
boiledChickenEgg: A moist, delicious boiled egg. Great tasting and packed with protein.
sheafOfHay: Long and almost sharp to the touch. These grass stalks are perfect for string making, animal feed, or tinder when dried.
niter: A natural mineral, ground up to be used as a preservative or for other chemical applications.
saltpeter: A ground mineral, to be used as a natural food preservative. If combined with other minerals, it can be combustible.
blackPowder: A highly combustible powder, made up of a combination of minerals.
flintlockPistol: A long range, high damage pistol. Requires black powder and bullets to fire.
giblets: A batch of cooked animal organs. Considerably repugnant, but nutritious and filling.
explosiveTrap: A mound of leaves used to conceal a volatile explosive powder. Stepping on it will trigger a small explosion.
skeletalMageWand: A mysterious, gnarled staff with a twinkling red gemstone attached to the end.
rawClayJug: A formed and sculpted jug molded from raw clay. Requires a cork and a kiln to be fired and hardened.
clayJug: A fully hardened clay jug with a cork. Used to hold water.
clayJugOfSeawater: Unfiltered seawater, held in a clay jug. Unsuitable to drink in its current form but could be desalinated.
clayJugOfDesalinatedWater: Potable, safe-to-drink water. The water in this clay jug has gone through the desalination process.
clayJugOfMedicinalWater: A clay jug containing medicinal water, used to cure and soothe certain ailments while also replenishing your thirst.
clayJugOfPurifiedFreshWater: A clay jug filled with fresh, purified water. Can be used to quench your thirst.
clayJugOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: 装有未净化淡水的陶罐
A clay jug full of natural, fresh water. Although it is drinkable, further purification is recommended.
rawClayBrick: A soft piece of raw clay, molded into a rectangle. Ready to be fired inside a kiln.
clayBrick: A hardened clay brick, used in the building of structures such as floors and walls.
clayWall: A wall made from clay bricks, set into a typical skewed, grid-like fashion to increase durability.
clayFlooring: 黏土砖做成的地板. 可用于建筑或室外装饰.
pineappleSeeds: Small brown seeds that can be planted to grow into pineapple plants.
raspberrySeeds: Seeds that will grow into a raspberry bush, given enough time and care.
pricklyPearSeeds: These appear to be prickly pear seeds. Can be planted to grow cacti or eaten.
clematisSeeds: Seeds to grow clematis. Can be eaten if desperate, but they do not contain any significant nutrition.
paperSheet: A large piece of paper. It appears to contain many recycled fibers. Suitable for drawing on with ink.
paperMold: A mold used for making paper. Contains a screen that holds wet recycled fibers to dry and press into flattened, usable paper.
beggarticks: The flower and stems of beggarticks. Only useful in creating medicinal tonics, or ingesting directly if food supply is low.
milkThistleFlowers: The flowering bulbs of a milk thistle plant. Filled with a bitter but nutritious milk.
drawnMap: A paper sheet, scrawled with geographical landmarks and features. Used to approximate a location when read.
tatteredClothShirt: A once fine piece of clothing, now torn and tattered.
tatteredClothTrousers: Brown colored trousers, now reduced to much shorter trousers from distress and wear.
woodenGate: A gate crafted from long wooden planks with small wooden hinges. Can be opened and closed when built.
poisonIvyLeaves: Causes irritation to the touch; these leaves of three do not belong on your person.
poisonIvySeeds: Bright green, soft seeds, used to plant to grow into poison ivy.
wroughtIronChest: A spacious container built from wrought iron that can store many items. Foods will spoil slower inside of it.
ironChest: A large iron chest that is both roomy and sturdy. Foods contained within will decay at a slower rate.
switchgrassSeeds: Long dried grass seeds. Can be planted to grow a longer type of grass.
apple: A juicy, delicious red apple. The fruit contains seeds to grow apple trees.
spiderEggs: Soft and squishy to the touch. These small silken eggs contain arachnid life inside.
tailFeathers: A fluffy clump of white feathers, removed from an avian creature's backside.
appleSeeds: Still scented like the apples they come from, these small brown seeds are used for planting to grow into apple trees.
venomGland: The venom producing gland of a snake, still filled with some immobilizing venom.
ornateWoodenChest: A decorative wooden container gilded with symbols inlaid into the wood.
rollOfRedCarpet: A rolled-up piece of red carpet, suitable for making a comfortable living space or welcoming important guests.
ornateCape: A red and gold stitched cape, which drapes the back and fastens at the neck. Worn as a status symbol.
fireBladder: An oddly shaped organ from a fire-breathing creature. Hot to the touch; it appears to contain a deadly chemical reaction inside.
goldenKey: A large and decorative key, plated in what appears to be gold.
woodenSword: A sturdy blunt sword, crafted from wood with a sharp piercing point. Most useful for sparring practice.
clayKiln: Similar to a furnace, but constructed with clay and in a way that allows for proper heat distribution for crafting glass and clay items.
clayCampfire: A grouping of clay bricks shaped into a ring to contain a fire.
clayFurnace: An enclosed structure made of clay bricks, which traps in the heat to keep a long-lasting, high-temperature fire.
clayWaterStill: A carved-out clay brick with a lid. It's used to desalinate water by boiling it and then collecting the steam into a separate container.
sandstoneCampfire: A grouping of sandstone shaped into a ring to contain a fire.
sandstoneFurnace: An enclosed structure made of sandstone, which traps in the heat to keep a long-lasting, high-temperature fire.
sandstoneWaterStill: A hollowed-out piece of sandstone with a lid. It's used to desalinate water by boiling it and then collecting the steam into a separate container.
graniteKiln: Similar to a furnace, but constructed with rocks and in a way that allows for proper heat distribution for crafting glass and clay items.
wroughtIronAnvil: An anvil made from wrought iron with a wooden base. Useful for metalworking.
ironAnvil: A sturdy iron anvil. Used in the production of metal armor, weapons, tools, and more.
mageRobe: An ancient tattered robe, once owned by a spell casting foe.
orbOfInfluence: A strange spherical orb that gives off a shimmering radiance on your touch. It appears to hum as you hold it.
animalClaw: A sharp claw from an animal. A perfect animal by-product for using as a needle.
animalPelt: The remains of an unlucky skinned animal. Can be used as a makeshift garment or dismantled into the hide and fur separately.
animalFur: A large clump of animal fur and hair. Could be used as tinder in a situation where wood is not available.
scales: Dried and hardened scales from a reptilian creature.
sharkFin: Not much more than a trophy, this carved dorsal fin remains slippery and rubbery to the touch.
rawReptileMeat: A grainy piece of edible reptile flesh. Generally, not safe to consume without being cooked due to bacteria.
cookedReptileMeat: A grilled piece of reptile meat. The look and texture could almost be passed as chicken.
tentacles: A slimy, wriggling appendage from an unlucky cephalopod. Can be eaten, but with some force due to the rubbery unpleasant texture.
cookedTentacles: Although, still springy to the touch, this cooked cephalopod appendage can be stomached much easier than if raw.
wormMeat: Essentially a mash of worm innards, almost ground up into a paste. Definitely not the most appetizing, but can be cooked for better flavor.
cookedWormMeat: A cooked patty of worm meat. Unappetizing to think about, but can provide as a good source of needed nutrition.
granitePickaxe: A primitive stone pickaxe used for mining into rock or as a stopgap blunt weapon.
wroughtIronAxe: An axe forged out of wrought iron, primarily used for lumberjacking and carving.
ironAxe: An iron-forged axe used in wood chopping. Its sharp end can be used for crafting and carving.
fertileSoil: A rich and nutrient-dense soil, suitable to grow all plants for maximum fertility and speed.
graniteHoe: A rudimentary tilling and gardening tool, used to break up soil for more successful growth of plants.
wroughtIronHoe: A long pole with a wrought iron metal blade attached to the end. Used to till the ground for planting seeds.
ironHoe: A long-handled gardening tool with a blade on the end, forged from iron. Used to till soil for better plant growth.
lavaBeetleHelmet: An extremely hard and fire-resistant helmet, sourced from the carcass of a fallen lava beetle.
spruceCone: A prickly cone from a spruce tree, filled with seeds contained inside its scales.
spruceSeeds: White seeds for growing a spruce tree, ejected from a spruce cone.
spruceNeedles: Dense, needled branches from a spruce tree. Useful for compost or drying out for tinder.
cypressCone: A rounded cone from a cypress tree, containing seeds.
cypressSeeds: Sharp to the touch, these seeds can be used for growing cypress trees.
cypressLeaves: Flat bladed foliage from a cypress tree. Can be used for tinder or compost when dried out.
lettuce: This leafy green vegetable is rich in vitamins and quite filling when eaten.
lettuceSeeds: Seeds taken from lettuce that has turned to seed.
chiveSeeds: The small black appearance of these seeds suggests they are for growing chives.
potato: Starchy edible tubers. Not suitable for consumption without cooking due to toxicity.
potatoSeeds: An alternative way to grow potatoes without using seed potatoes. These will grow into a potato plant seedling.
carrot: A healthy looking root vegetable, orange in color and full of nutrients. Both the taproot and leaves are edible.
carrotSeeds: Seeds for growing carrots, taken from seeding carrot flowers.
cornEar: An ear of corn, wrapped in its husk; ready to be shucked and cooked, or eaten raw.
cornSeeds: Dried and aged corn kernels, used for planting and growing corn stalks.
cucumber: A cucumiform gourd fruit, grown from a creeping vine. Full of nutrients and packed with water content.
cucumberSeeds: Seeds taken from inside the fruit of a cucumber.
tomato: Red, plump and juicy, this savory fruit can be eaten raw for replenishment of hunger as well as some thirst.
tomatoSeeds: Seeds from a tomato, ready for planting and germination to grow into tomato plants.
pumpkin: A heavy orange squash, filled with edible pulp. Contains 的种子 for growing more.
pumpkinSeeds: Large, flat pumpkin seeds. Can be shelled and eaten or planted as is.
pricklyPearFruit: The fruiting body of a prickly pear cactus. The insides are extremely red and juicy.
sugarCaneStalks: Stout, jointed, fibrous stalks that are rich in the sugar content. They can be quite long and the insides can be chewed on for sustenance.
sugarCaneSeeds: Seeds for planting and growing crops of sugar cane stalks.
bushelOfWheat: The clipped remains of the stalk and grains from wheat grass.
wheat: The hulled spikelets from wheat grass, containing the raw grains.
cookedPotato: A skin-on cooked potato; soft and mushy and packed with calories.
cookedCornCob: A well cooked cob of corn. Ready to consume and enjoy.
bundleOfSwitchgrass: Bundled up switchgrass stalks, complete with its seeds.
cloak: An old, but sturdy hooded cloak garment. It appears to be of high quality from a bygone era.
woodenMortarAndPestle: Carved from wood; this makeshift device can be used for crushing up items.
sandstoneMortarAndPestle: A mortar and pestle carved from sandstone, used to grind up other items.
wroughtIronMortarAndPestle: Used for pulverizing items, forged from wrought iron.
ironMortarAndPestle: Forged from iron; this device can be used for crushing and grinding other items.
rawClayMortarAndPestle: An unfired mortar and pestle, used as a grinding device when hardened.
clayMortarAndPestle: A grinding device made from fired and cured clay.
copperOre: Raw copper ore with a tinge of oxidation. Can be smelted into ingot form with a cast.
copperIngot: A dense, formed brick of copper. Slag and other impurities have been removed, making it useful for forging into tools, weapons, and armor.
copperPickaxe: A copper pick tool, primarily used for mining rocks and stones; however, copper may not the best choice for such a tool.
copperDoubleAxe: An almost lumbering and unwieldy copper weapon and tool.
copperShovel: A copper digging tool, used for lifting soils or resource gathering.
copperSpear: A long piercing weapon with a copper spearhead.
copperHammer: Although copper tends to be quite malleable, this copper hammer will do the trick in most cases for repair and other crafts.
copperLockpick: A small and precise device used for picking locks, made with refined copper ore.
copperBuckler: A rounded copper offhanded armor piece. Copper can be an ideal material for taking a beating with such a design.
copperGauntlets: Complex and intricate, but still fairly durable. These copper hand armor pieces are used to block damage to your extremities.
copperGreaves: Sturdy copper leggings that can be tied around your legs, shielding them from damage.
copperGorget: A shiny copper neck protection piece.
copperHelmet: A piece of copper head armor, designed with ancient sensibilities.
copperBoots: Copper boots, work hardened and crafted to fit closely to your feet size.
copperCuirass: Cold formed in a classic abdominal design, this copper cuirass can protect your torso from damage.
copperSword: A sharp and work hardened copper blade, designed for close quarter combat.
copperTongs: Tongs crafted from copper, used to grasp hot objects, protecting your hands and fingers.
copperArrow: A fletched arrow, made with feathers and a copper arrowhead.
copperBullet: A nearly solid copper bullet. Used as ammunition for slings and other ranged weaponry.
copperArrowhead: A sharp pointed arrowhead, formed from copper. Can be used as a carving implement.
copperChest: A roomy copper chest, used for caching items and food storage, reducing spoilage.
copperAnvil: A heavy shaped slab of copper perched on a wooden base, used in the production of metal weapons, tools, and armor.
copperAxe: The perfect tool for tree chopping and gathering. This copper-bladed implement can also be used in carving and crafts that require a sharp tool.
copperHoe: A gardening tool used to till ground. This tool is cold worked from copper.
copperMortarAndPestle: Used as a grinding and crushing tool. This mortar and pestle is sharped and work hardened from solid copper.
waterskinOfGoatMilk: A filled leather waterskin containing the raw milk from a goat.
clayJugOfGoatMilk: A clay jug full of nutritious raw goat milk.
glassBottleOfGoatMilk: A bottled batch of goat milk, filled to the top of this glass bottle.
obsidian: An extremely sharp and hard shard of obsidian, useful for cutting, but very brittle.
ornateBlueBook: An expensive looking book with a blue hard cover. The insides and back have heavy wear on inspection.
journal: A leather-bound soft journal. It appears it has seen a lot of use over time.
mossCoveredBook: A book that has seen better days. It smells of mold and earth and seems fragile.
gildedRedBook: An old, fancy looking book with a red cover, gilded with golden trim.
arrowShaft: A whittled down pole, used for the shaft of a fletched arrow.
slitherSucker: A living, writhing slither sucker, constricting itself to you, causing pain as it sinks its teeth into you.
aberrantSlitherSucker: A living, writhing aberrant slither sucker, constricting itself to you, causing pain as it sinks its teeth into you.
strawHat: A hat made from braids of hay, woven together. What it lacks in protection, it makes up for in its sun-blocking properties and style.
blackplateSabatons: Almost sharp to the touch, these expertly crafted annealed blackplate iron sabatons will make for satisfactory foot protection as well as fashion.
blackplateBreastplate: A uniquely designed piece of armor to cover your torso with long sharpened points jutting out from the shoulders. Made from a special annealed form of iron.
blackplateGauntlets: Crafted from annealed iron, these blackplate gauntlets make for excellent hand guards.
blackplateGorget: A neck guard, forged from iron and annealed, giving it a darker appearance.
blackplateGreaves: These leggings are crafted from iron and annealed, giving it a darkened hue and widened to make the wearer appear larger.
blackplateHelmet: An evil gaze has been forged into the face of this annealed iron helmet, giving the wearer a menacing look upon equipping it. Two sturdy metal horns pierce outwards, mimicking some form of animal.
deathKnightAxe: A uniquely forged axe with a gnarled design; the signature of a powerful death knight. The entire weapon is casted, making it very heavy, but powerful.
macuahuitl: A wooden club, adorned with razor-sharp fragments of obsidian. Brittle in combat, but deadly and effective in practice.
obsidianArrow: A fletched arrow using an obsidian arrowhead, delivering substantial piercing potential.
obsidianArrowhead: A brittle, but razor-sharp arrow tip, to be crafted into an arrow with a shaft and fletching.
obsidianAxe: An axe with an obsidian blade, known for its slashing prowess, but also brittle in practice.
obsidianKnife: A shard of obsidian fastened into a handle and bound with string. Can be used as a carving tool or in short-range combat.
obsidianShovel: A digging tool with a large piece of obsidian attached to the end. Beautiful to look at, but less effective due to the fragility of the obsidian.
obsidianSpear: An obsidian-tipped polearm used in melee combat or thrown for added range.
tumbleweedSeeds: Small and slightly thorny, these seeds are used to plant and grow tumbleweeds, as if you ever wanted to grow weeds.
coconutHusk: The fibrous outer layer of a coconut. Useful as cordage, pulp, and tinder for starting fires.
peeledCoconut: The remaining coconut fruit after husking the outer layer. Its innards contain thirst-quenching coconut water and protein-rich meat. You may fashion this into a coconut container with string and cork.
coconutMeat: An opened coconut fruit, revealing its fleshy edible coconut meat.
coconutContainerOfCoconutWater: A coconut fruit, affixed with a string and cork to contain its natural juice. The container can be reused for other liquids once consumed.
coconutContainer: An interim liquid container, crafted by poking a hole into a coconut and sealed using a cork.
coconutContainerOfSeawater: A coconut container filled with seawater. Not suitable for consuming without first being desalinated to remove all the salt content and other impurities.
coconutContainerOfDesalinatedWater: 装有蒸馏水的椰子容器
A coconut filled with water that has gone through the desalination process.
coconutContainerOfMedicinalWater: A coconut containing medicinal water, used for treating certain conditions while also quenching some thirst.
coconutContainerOfPurifiedFreshWater: Potable and purified fresh water, enclosed in a coconut container.
coconutContainerOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: 装有未净化水的椰子容器
A container full of unpurified fresh water, contained within a coconut. Purification is recommended before consumption.
coconutContainerOfGoatMilk: This coconut container is filled with goat milk, no doubt giving a unique flavor when consumed.
oldEducationalScroll: An unfurled scroll with a large amount of text explaining some in-depth knowledge on a specific skill.
strippedLeather: Thin strips of cut leather, useful for making strings and rope.
claySandCastFlask: A moulded clay flask, used for casting and shaping molten metal using malleable green sand.
sandstoneSandCastFlask: A mold for casting molten metals, made with a green sand mixture and placed into a carved piece of sandstone.
graniteSandCastFlask: A hollowed out rock with green sand moulding inside. Used for casting metal into any shape.
animalGlue: A natural glue processed from boiling animal bones that can be used to reinforce and secure items.
copalResin: Ground-up hardened tree resin. Can be melted with high heat to be used as a reinforcement and binding material.
boneMeal: A pestled pile of powdered bone remnants.
pileOfDesertSand: A pile of coarse desert sand with an orange hue. Can be refined for use in glass making.
joshuaTreeLeaves: A bundle of spiny 短叶丝兰 leaves which are almost as unique looking as the 短叶丝兰 itself. Suitable for usage as cordage or dried out and used as tinder.
joshuaTreeFruit: The oval-shaped fruiting body of the 短叶丝兰. It appears to be edible but may be more pleasant cooked.
joshuaTreeSeeds: Large black seeds extracted from a 短叶丝兰 fruit.
cookedJoshuaTreeFruit: Roasted and dried 短叶丝兰 fruit. It gives off a delightful aroma and has a sweet taste.
joshuaTreeFlowers: A blossoming batch of flowers gathered from a 短叶丝兰. The flowers are sticky to the touch and smell quite sweet and possibly edible if not a bit bitter.
saguaroCactusFruit: A fleshy pod gathered from a saguaro cactus. It can be cut open to discover its juicy red innards.
saguaroCactusSeeds: Oblong black seeds extracted from the fruit of the saguaro cactus.
saguaroCactusChunk: A hefty chunk of wet, de-spined cacti. There does appear to be quite a bit of liquid contained in the soft flesh, but it smells odd.
graniteWell: A granite-built enclosure used to trap and collect groundwater when constructed.
sandstoneWell: A round empty enclosure made of sandstone, which can be built and extended deep into the ground to collect water.
clayWell: A well constructed of clay bricks, used to collect water by digging a shaft into the ground.
aloeVeraLeaves: Thick succulent plant leaves, sharp to the touch and known for their use as an antiseptic. Their inner flesh can be applied to the skin to reduce burning pain.
aloeVeraSeeds: These thin black seeds appear to be that from an aloe vera plant. They can be used to grow aloe vera or eaten in dire circumstances.
deadScorpion: A dispatched scorpion, ready to be skewered and cooked for the brave indifferent eater.
deadAberrantScorpion: The body of a large aberrant scorpion. It can be cooked over low heat to provide a more palatable eating experience.
cookedScorpion: While still a bit nauseating to consume, the cooked scorpion can provide much needed sustenance.
cookedAberrantScorpion: Even though the aberrant scorpion is larger, and its corpse will provide much more food, the texture will most likely be worse when consuming it.
scorpionStinger: A dangerous item to be held indeed. This scorpion stinger still contains its venom.
copperBakingTray: A thin rimmed baking sheet made from copper, primarily used for baking foods.
wroughtIronBakingTray: A rigid sheet pan crafted from flattened wrought iron.
ironBakingTray: A baking sheet crafted from iron and used for baking. It has raised edges to help retain food and shallow liquids.
flour: Wheat ground down into a white powdery form. Used in the process of making dough.
dough: A simple kneaded dough consisting of wheat flour and water. The consistency leaves a lot to be desired for baked goods, but it may suffice for some recipes.
hardtack: A nonperishable biscuit, baked at high temperatures for long periods of time to remove all moisture from it.
hitchingPost: A sturdy wooden structure fastened with a large rope. It can be used to hitch animals and creatures to restrict their movement.
shreddedPaper: Torn pieces paper assembled into a loose pile. Can be turned into a mash and used as pulp or used as tinder in firemaking.
rawMudskipper: The muddy corpse of a mudskipper, ready to clean and cook. It doesn't appear suitable to eat without cooking.
rawAberrantMudskipper: An enormous specimen indeed. This aberrant-sized mudskipper will make for quite the dish once cleaned and cooked.
cookedMudskipper: Not the best catch for sustenance or for its looks. Its bulgy eyes at least have been removed for eating.
cookedAberrantMudskipper: A large fishy feast brought to you by an atypical mudskipper.
rawRedSnapper: A massive red snapper, ready to be cooked or dined on raw in a pinch.
cookedRedSnapper: A hefty meal for anybody; this cooked red snapper is sure to delight taste buds and satisfy bellies.
rawWalleye: A rather large walleye, ready to gut and cook whole or eat raw when on the run.
cookedWalleye: A fully cooked walleye. Its seared skin and white fleshy interior looks delicious.
woodenShield: A sturdy wooden shield, quite effective at blocking blunt attacks. The handles on the back are fashioned out of wood and string.
copperRefinementTools: A set of delicate copper tools used for shaving material out of an item, decreasing its weight at the cost of durability.
wroughtIronRefinementTools: Used for gouging out material from items, reducing their weight and durability. Forged and crafted from wrought iron.
ironRefinementTools: A fine set of iron 精制工具, used for rasping and scraping out material from items to reduce their weight, costing their durability.
scaleBelt: A belt formed from braided cords of dried reptile skin used to keep your leggings up and for some moderate waist protection.
scaleVest: A fire-resistant vest made from sewn scales that can take a good beating.
scaleBoots: Scale-bound boots, sewn together using dried reptile skin.
scaleCap: A stylish winged cap made from scaly reptile skin.
scaleBevor: A reptile skin fashioned neck and chin guard.
scaleLeggings: Semi-tight leggings, crafted from dried and stretched reptile skin.
scaleGloves: Skillfully crafted scale gloves, used for hand protection when gathering or tending to your campfire.
cookedJoshuaTreeFlowers: A cooked batch of 短叶丝兰 flowers. The cooking process retains most of the nutrients but reduces some of the bitterness found in their uncooked form.
saguaroCactusRibs: The dried innards of a fallen saguaro cactus. This gnarled and hardened woody resource is useful for fuel or dismantling for materials.
bladesOfGrass: Clippings of grass; sharp to the touch when fresh, but can be dried and used for tinder.
animalDroppings: Droppings produced by a small mammal to be used in composting.
animalDung: A seemingly fresh pile of feces, excreted from an animal. Although quite foul, it can perhaps be used for fertilizer.
guano: The excrement of a bat, to be used as a great fertilizer due to its high content of nitrogen, phosphate, and potassium.
tallow: The rendered form of animal fat; solid when kept cooled. A fatty and greasy substance used in cooking or as fuel.
tallowCandle: A molded tallow candle with a string as a wick. A long-lasting source of illumination.
litTallowCandle: Burning long and bright, this delicious smelling tallow candle lights your way.
wispDust: A magical glowing pile of dust, extracted from a wisp. It inexplicably feels weightless, yet burdensome in your hands.
magicalAspect: A magical compound that is warm to the touch and ready to apply on to items, mutatating its characteristics.
goldenSextant: A metallic brass-coated navigational tool. Used for measuring the horizon and sun to judge distances.
rawChoppedFish: A roughly chopped assortment of fish meat and viscera to be used as bait or cooked for consumption in several manners.
cookedChoppedFish: A sizable helping of chopped fish cooked and ready to ingest.
cookedFishKebab: A skewered mass of fish chunks cooked delicately over flame to be consumed off the spear for an added flare.
ashCement: A tacky slurry of cement, created by grinding ash and mixing it with liquid to form a clay-like consistency.
ashCementBrick: Ash cement formed into rectangular blocks then baked in a fire.
ashCementFlooring: 交叠的灰水泥砖制成的地板.
ashCementWall: A wall constructed of recycled ash cement. Although the resource is abundant, the durability is not.
iceShard: A quickly melting jagged shard of ice. Can be melted down to liquid form using a container.
penguinEgg: A rather large egg laid by a penguin. The shape differs slightly from a chicken's egg and feels much denser.
boiledPenguinEgg: The whites of this egg are translucent, and the yolk is unset and bright orange. Although much different than a chicken egg, it will be just as packed with protein and nutrition.
rawPenguinMeat: A carved portion of penguin meat. The meat is very oily and comes off as a cross between fish, chicken, and mammalian meat.
cookedPenguinMeat: Although slightly off-putting, this greasy cooked meat will provide ample sustenance.
crowberries: Purplish-black berries taken from the small shrubbery of a crowberry plant. They are acidic, bitter and possibly toxic, but could be more palatable cooked.
cookedCrowberries: A stewed batch of crowberries, emphasizing their natural sugars while removing their bitter tannins.
crowberrySeeds: Tiny red-brown seeds taken from a batch of crowberry drupes.
winterberries: A twig of bright red winterberries. They look like the type of berry that would be consumed by birds, but may be harmful to humans.
winterberrySeeds: A handful of seeds, presumably used to plant and grow more winterberries, a holly plant that can grow in colder climates.
arcticPoppies: A bundle of bright yellow poppies of the arctic variety which can be used medicinally.
arcticPoppySeeds: A large collection of small poppy seeds.
pirateHat: A cocked hat, typically worn by seafaring people and more notably, pirate folk known for their distinctive tricorne style.
aloeVeraBandage: A dual purpose bandage type. Used to treat bleeding as well as the effects of being burned.
sharkTooth: A large tooth from a shark, serrated along its edges and sharp the touch. Could be used as a rudimentary cutting tool.
copperKnife: A flattened and sharpened copper blade, affixed to a smooth handle, carved and fitted for each finger and thumb.
wroughtIronKnife: A pointed knife crafted from wrought iron; ideal in usage for carving and crafting.
ironKnife: A razor-sharp iron edge bound to a delicately polished handle. Can be used in many situations including combat, harvesting, carving, and more.
tinOre: A small fragment of tin ore, mixed with other elemental impurities.
tinIngot: A refined block of tin, ready to be cast or shaped into soft, metal implements.
tinPickaxe: A pickaxe made from a pole and tin head. The softness of tin leaves a lot to be desired for such a tool.
tinDoubleAxe: A double-ended tin axe; more decorative than combat-ready due to the softness of the metal of choice.
tinShovel: A shovel that would likely deform easily when used in practice due to the use of tin as the metal of choice in this craft.
tinSpear: A spear with a point crafted from tin. Upon any impact, you expect this to become blunt instantly.
tinHammer: A tin-forged hammer, used for many crafts or repairing items.
tinLockpick: A soft metal lockpicking tool with seemingly very fragile prongs. A delicate touch may be required.
tinShield: A uniquely designed tin shield, seemingly forged from a large slab of tin. The design might be the only thing going for it due to the deformation properties of tin.
tinGloves: Delicately crafted tin-forged gloves, used for style and moderate protection. Mostly for style.
tinChausses: A pair of tin leggings to be used as inferior protection or as decoration.
tinBevor: A protective covering for one's neck and chin; crafted from tin.
tinHelmet: A uniquely styled helmet made from tin. It becomes low in durability when used for its practical purpose.
tinFootgear: A pair of tin-crafted shoes. They are lightweight, but probably not the most durable.
tinCuirass: A front-to-back upper body protective armor piece, crafted from tin.
tinSword: A tin sword that deforms easily; ready to be used in combat. "Ready" may be a stretch.
tinTongs: One would think these tongs might be more decorative than practical given that the melting temperature of tin is so low.
tinArrow: A fletched arrow with a tin arrowhead affixed to the shaft. Ready to strike a creature from afar. The arrowhead will deform on impact.
tinBullet: A soft and lightweight ball of tin to be used in slings.
tinArrowhead: Although this likely won't make a great arrow in the end, it might get the job done if blunt and piercing damage is what you are after.
tinChest: A tin chest crafted with an exaggerated boxy design. Suitable for holding all types of materials and items.
tinAnvil: A large formed metal surface, propped up on some wood. One might think a better idea would be to reverse that order due to the softness of tin.
tinAxe: A tin axe with a curved edge, used for wood chopping. Not likely to be effective for long or at all in this task due to the softness of tin.
tinHoe: A tin hoe, to be used for tilling the ground to plant seeds. The tool's head will likely deteriorate quickly.
tinMortarAndPestle: Used for mixing and grinding materials, this tin device feels much lighter than it looks.
tinBakingTray: This large sheet of molded tin can be used to cook food, although some care may be required to make sure it doesn't melt in application.
tinRefinementTools: Delicate tin-based tools, used to refine and reduce the weight of other crafted items.
tinKnife: A tin forged knife with a fine edge and quality handle. Its edge will quickly become blunt in use.
bronzeIngot: A pristine brick of molded bronze alloy to be melted down and cast into other forms.
bronzePickaxe: A bronze-cast tool for use in mining and breaking through rock-based terrain.
bronzeDoubleAxe: A two-sided axe forged in bronze and affixed to a pole with string. Used primarily for combat.
bronzeShovel: A digging tool with a bronze shovel head with many applications such as chopping, mining, digging, and more.
bronzeSpear: The spearhead cast from bronze adorns the end of a long, widdled, and smooth pole; together forming this well-crafted spear.
bronzeHammer: A bronzen mallet tool, used for repairing and crafting other items, especially those made from metal.
bronzeLockpick: A fine and superior bronze lockpicking contraption. Although it appears complex, it is bound to work wonders on stubborn locks.
bronzeKiteShield: A shield formed into a kite shape allowing protection along a full body length. A unique pattern is riveted to its center.
bronzeGauntlets: Bronze-forged hand protective armor. These gauntlets feature unique barbed bracer designs working their way up your forearms.
bronzeGreaves: A pair of bronze greaves, used to wrap and fit against your legs for more than adequate protection.
bronzeBevor: A piece of protective bronze armor for the chin and neck area.
bronzeHelmet: A helmet fit for royalty, at least from the looks alone. This stylishly crafted headgear is great for taking a beating as well as looking illustrious.
bronzeBoots: Many delicately crafted bronze pieces are hinged together to form these protective boots.
bronzeChestArmor: A bronze armor chest piece with a unique, stylish design with split tassets for additional waist and upper thigh protection.
bronzeSword: Masterly crafted, this bronze sword sparkles with an astonishing luster, seemingly almost capable of blinding your foes with its sheen alone.
bronzeTongs: Cast bronze metal tongs, used for blacksmithing endeavors and lifting hot objects out of fires.
bronzeArrow: Straight and true this arrow looks to be, decorated with a sharp bronze arrowhead.
bronzeBullet: A spherical ball of alloyed metal to be used as ammunition in slings and other devices.
bronzeArrowhead: One touch to the tip of this would lead to certain bloodshed. This bronze arrowhead is ready to affix to a wooden shaft and fletching to create an arrow.
bronzeChest: Your best bet for large storage capacity. This masterly crafted bronze chest is suitable for storing a plethora of items.
bronzeAnvil: A shaped wedge of alloyed bronze conducive to hammering metal objects on for the procurement of weapons, tools, or armor.
bronzeAxe: A bronzen axe, used for carving, gathering, and general lumberjacking functions.
bronzeHoe: A fine bronzen gardening tool, used to form lined pathways in the dirt for planting seeds.
bronzeMortarAndPestle: Using a bronze alloy, this set of tools can be used to crush and grind materials used in other crafts.
bronzeBakingTray: Excessive is one word used to describe this piece of cookware made from forged bronze.
bronzeRefinementTools: A set of small bronze tools used for filing, shaping, and general refinement of other items, reducing their weight in the process.
bronzeKnife: An expertly crafted carving tool and an instrument of death if used in close quarters against an unwitting foe.
iceBrick: A solid block of ice, chipped and carved away from a glacier or ice wall.
snowBrick: A compressed block of snow. Dense and rigid enough to perhaps build a wall or flooring for a makeshift snow hut.
iceWall: Constructed from large ice bricks, this towering cold barrier can be built to protect against the elements, although, to a limited degree due to its temperature.
iceFlooring: 一大堆交织着的光滑冰砖. 没见过的人可能会认为这是在异想天开.
snowWall: An erected wall of compressed bricks of snow to be used to build a snow hut.
snowFlooring: 一种积雪压实而成的雪砖，常常铺设于冰雪小屋之内.
caliginousScrap: This piece of material fell from the dark foe. It appears to be vanishing as you hold it.
magicalExtract: A heap of what could only be described as "darkness". Cold to the touch and unsettling. Your mind races as a general unease washes over you.
shimmeringFibers: A few strands of fiber of an unknown origin that appear to catch the light at just the right way and dance light across your hands.
magicalTwine: A seemingly unbreakable piece of twine; glowing as you hold it. Can be used to enhance other items.
sandstoneHammer: A hammer carved out of sandstone. It appears very brittle and will not survive many uses.
sandstoneBullet: A bullet for use with slings to take a shot at some hapless creature. It is likely to break quickly due to the use of sandstone in its creation.
sandstoneAnvil: An anvil crafted from sandstone, possibly not the best material for such a task due to its brittle form.
snowScarecrow: A representation of a human figure created with piles of snow and adorned with unique items for its limbs and facial features.
frozenFlesh: A piece of what appears to be rotten flesh, luckily frozen to be disposed of before thawing out.
animalTusk: A lumbering curved tusk from a large mammal. Can be used as a primitive weapon or carved and broken down into other forms.
whitePineCone: A sap-covered pine cone, dropped or gathered from a white pine tree. It appears to still contain the seeds within.
whitePineSeeds: Seeds harvested from a white pine cone for planting or eating.
whitePineNeedles: Distinctively long pine needles from a white pine tree, emitting a pleasant aroma as you hold them.
furCoat: A balmy chest garment crafted from the furry hide of an animal.
furMittens: A pair of fur mittens with one compartment for your fingers, and another one for your thumb for increased warmth.
furBoots: A set of boots designed for colder climates, made from animal pelts with extra fur added for protection and comfort.
birdDroppings: Droppings produced by some type of winged creature. Can be used as an ingredient in compost.
hardenedCoil: An extremely heavy metallic coil with a spring-like frame that resonates an odd noise as it moves around in your pack.
magicalBinding: A sturdy magical binding that appears to be suitable to attach to equipment in some form.
armoredScales: Hardened, keratin-based scales useful for crafting protective armor.
rawPangolinMeat: An edible cut of meat butchered from an unlucky pangolin. Likely not suitable to eat uncooked.
cookedPangolinMeat: A well-done piece of cooked pangolin meat, hopefully free from any parasites or viruses.
armoredScaleBelt: Together with string and armored scales, this garment is meant to hold up any leggings or pants while providing defense to your waist section.
armoredScaleVest: Armor crafted with alternating small and large keratin scales arranged in the shape of a vest.
armoredScaleBoots: Finely crafted boots, made from armored scales and tightly wrapped and sewn together in the form of footwear.
armoredScaleCrown: An arrangement of armored scales shaped into a headband appearing like a crown when worn.
armoredScaleBevor: A rather uncomplicated piece of neck protecting armor made from armored scales.
armoredScaleCuisses: Thigh and leg coverings crafted with armored keratin-based scales.
armoredScaleGloves: A pair of gloves crafted with armored scales. Not the most comfortable, but appears to be quite protective on one's hands.
tinNeedle: A needle molded from tin and not likely to hold a point for long.
copperNeedle: A pointed copper needle used for sewing and stitching, both fabrics and flesh on occasion.
wroughtIronNeedle: A useful implement for stitching together items with cordage or string.
ironNeedle: A strong and rather broad iron needle. Hopefully, this ends up being used on fabrics more than for sutures.
bronzeNeedle: A needle with a fine point, crafted from bronze and primed for sewing.
tuftsOfTanglehead: Tufts of tanglehead grass; prickly and clingy to the touch. They seem to stick and tangle to each other as you hold them.
tangleheadSeeds: Seeds for growing tanglehead grass, known for its tendency to tangle together due to their paired spikelet heads and small clingy fibers.
wispInAGlassBottle: A confined wisp, visible through the glass in its compressed form. Its blue light dances around as you hold it.
aberrantWispInAGlassBottle: 装有变异鬼火的玻璃瓶
An aberrant wisp trapped in a glass bottle. It violently shakes and moves around as you grasp the bottle.
wispInAClayJug: A 陶罐 with a trapped wisp contained within. It emits a strange sound as it rumbles around in your pack.
aberrantWispInAClayJug: A clay jug filled to the brim with an odd, malicious creature known as a wisp. You can attempt to pour it out if you are so daring.
wispInACoconutContainer: A captured wisp, held within a coconut container.
aberrantWispInACoconutContainer: 装有变异鬼火的椰子容器
An angry fiery gaseous entity trapped within the confines of a coconut container.
wispInAWaterskin: A waterskin containing a very special creature.
aberrantWispInAWaterskin: An imprisoned aberrant wisp, held within an ordinary waterskin. It likely will not be happy after being released.
strawScarecrow: A decoy meant to appear as a menacing tall humanoid, perhaps striking fear into lesser creatures and animals.
cactusScarecrow: A stack of cacti, carved and stood as if it were a human. Just much greener and much more spikey.
clothShirt: A simple white short-sleeved shirt, perfect for a sunny day, and not so much otherwise.
clothTrousers: A fine, if not plain looking pair of brown trousers, suitable for covering your lower regions a bit.
unripePapaya: An unripened green and hardened papaya fruit. Likely not suitable to eat yet.
papaya: A ripened papaya, firm to the touch, with some give to it. Ready to be cut open and eaten.
papayaSeeds: A gelatinous handful of slimey papaya seeds. They don't seem very appetizing, but may be safe to consume.
palapalaiFrond: The leaves from a palapalai fern, slightly prickly to a touch with small bristlelike hairs that cover the leaves.
palapalaiSpores: Harvested spores; contained in small casings, taken from the underside of fern fronds for growing palapalai.
buttonMushroomSpores: The spore print from a button mushroom. The spores can be placed into soil for attempting to grow into mycelium, then into mushrooms.
flyAmanitaSpores: Spores removed from the fly amanita for attempting to grow more of them.
brambleCrown: A twisted circular floral arrangement meant to wear as royalty wears a crown.
darkBrambleCrown: A blackened, unnaturally dark arrangement of twigs, leaves, and other brush. Uncomfortably, to be worn as a crown.
cotton: This downy fiber is an ideal material for spinning thread and making fabrics.
waterskinOfSwampWater: A waterskin container filled with noxious swamp liquid. Filtration of the water is likely recommended.
glassBottleOfSwampWater: Bottled swamp water; filled to the brim. Its murky green hue is visible through the glass.
clayJugOfSwampWater: A jug filled with liquid from swamplands. It is not recommended to consume this without filtration.
coconutContainerOfSwampWater: 装有沼泽水的椰子容器
A foul smelling container of swamp water.
waterskinOfFilteredWater: A waterskin filled to its cork with recently filtered water.
glassBottleOfFilteredWater: Clean, drinkable water in a glass bottle, decontaminated using a filtration technique.
clayJugOfFilteredWater: Filtered water in a clay jug; free from any large particulates and other potentially harmful matter.
coconutContainerOfFilteredWater: 装有过滤水的椰子容器
A coconut filled with purified water through the use of a water filter; slowly dripped into the makeshift container.
clayFilter: A three-part water filtration device made from fired clay.
sandstoneAxe: A seemingly well-constructed axe, the blade of which is made from sandstone and fastened with cordage.
sandstoneShovel: Although not using the best material; due to sandstone's softness, this shovel may get at least a few holes dug.
sharpSandstone: Through grinding and knapping two pieces of sandstone together, this sharp sandstone was produced.
smoothSandstone: A smoothened piece of sandstone, produced through some rather laborious grinding.
sandstoneSpear: A sandstone spear that feels straight and true as you hold it in your hands.
sandstoneKnife: A knife crafted with sandstone as the blade. It may not take a beating, but will produce its intended results, at least for awhile.
sandstonePickaxe: A rather unfitting material for a pickaxe; this soft tool may crumble fast while using it to 采掘.
sandstoneHoe: A gardening hoe, used to till the ground to sow seeds, crafted from sandstone.
sandstoneDeadfall: Essentially, a large piece of sandstone propped up on a stick, used to injure or kill an unwitting creature.
sandstoneSundial: A primitive tool used to tell time that will have to make due in the current circumstances.
woodenPlank: A straight plank of wood, cut down, sized, and planed from a raw tree log with moderate precision.
woodenWheel: A rudimentary wheel, carved and cut down from a wooden plank.
woodenAxle: A wooden rod, used to attach two wheels to a cart.
woodenMinecart: A 矿车 crafted from wooden planks and wheels that should work for quite a while provided it doesn't come into contact with fire.
woodenRail: This long, sturdy piece of wood is shaped for 矿车 wheels to rotate on to when assembled into a track.
woodenTrack: A section of mine track crafted using wooden rails and planks to secure everything together.
tinWheel: A wheel crafted from hammering a tin ingot into a circular shape with holes punched out for an axle to go through.
tinAxle: Using possibly the worst material for a spindle that goes between two wheels, this axle will be affixed under a cart to provide motion.
tinMinecart: A 矿车 crafted from hammered-out sheets of tin and affixed to wheels and axles.
tinRail: One of two tin rails needed to craft a track for carts to move on.
tinTrack: A track made with tin rails, a likely dreadful choice of materials for something that requires taking quite a beating.
copperWheel: A single copper wheel, shaped from a copper ingot. Three more of these and you will be able to create a 矿车.
copperAxle: Essentially, a long copper pole to be used in conjunction with wheels.
copperMinecart: A copper cart, made from flattened pieces of copper ingots, cold-worked and formed into a sturdy transport wagon.
copperRail: A long copper rail, molded from a copper ingot and used for mine tracks.
copperTrack: A track made from wooden planks and copper rails and hammered together for added support.
wroughtIronWheel: A sand-casted wheel, forged from wrought iron and suitable for affixing to a 矿车.
wroughtIronAxle: A proficiently crafted wrought iron axle, used to attach two wheels to in a 矿车 build.
wroughtIronMinecart: A construction of smelted wrought iron as the cart base, two axles, and four wheels.
wroughtIronRail: Basically, a shaped long metal rail, made from wrought iron and used for tracks.
wroughtIronTrack: A set of wrought iron tracks primarily used for the movement of carts on which they sit.
ironWheel: A forged and deftly crafted iron wheel for use with a 矿车.
ironAxle: A spindle of iron, shaped with slots for wheels to fit into.
ironMinecart: A sturdy-built 矿车 made from forged iron, ready to hit the tracks and move swiftly on.
ironRail: One piece of the puzzle when it comes to building tracks which consists of two of these and wooden planks.
ironTrack: When set down, these iron tracks will provide a sturdy and smooth ride for most 矿车 configurations.
bronzeWheel: A bronze-casted wheel, forged from a combination of tin and copper, increasing its strength and durability.
bronzeAxle: An axle cast from bronze, used primarily to join two wheels on a 矿车.
bronzeMinecart: A 矿车, crafted from bronze on top of four bronze wheels, sure to provide a smooth, fast ride.
bronzeRail: A lengthy bronze rail, utilized for the construction of tracks along with wooden planks.
bronzeTrack: A track consisting of bronze rail pieces and wooden planks, configured and hooked together for added durability.
basaltArrow: An arrow fletched with fine feathers and an arrowhead knapped from dark basalt rock.
basaltArrowhead: An arrowhead sharpened from repeatedly striking a larger piece of basalt.
basalt: A large, heavy column of basalt, distinctive in shape and look.
basaltMortarAndPestle: A mortar and pestle crafted from smoothed basalt rock with a slight shimmer and polished look to it.
basaltAxe: An axe that is bound to make short work out of trees and the odd creature alike.
basaltShovel: A shovel that uses basalt in its assembly that will most likely be strong enough to get quite a few holes dug; albeit, a bit heavy to use.
sharpBasalt: A sharpened piece of basalt that was created using a knapping method; hitting two stones together.
smoothBasalt: A smoothed and polished piece of dark basalt rock, used in the construction of pestles and mortars.
basaltSpear: No animal or creature would be safe from a hit of this spear, adorned with a sharpened strong piece of basalt on the end.
basaltFlooring: 砖砌一样联结的火山岩块.
basaltWall: A wall fabricated of multiple heavy columnar basalt pieces. A quite tedious construction, but strong and durable.
basaltCampfire: An assortment of basalt rocks, formed into a ring shape used for a makeshift fire enclosure.
basaltFurnace: A furnace constructed of many basalt rocks, ready to be used in many crafts that require a consistent, high heat.
basaltHammer: A quintessential tool for repairing, deforming, and building, this hammer uses basalt and can withstand quite a bit of impact.
basaltAnvil: This anvil made from hard and durable basalt can be used in the production of metal items, helping form them by striking while the iron is hot.
basaltDeadfall: A trap used for crushing and otherwise injuring hapless creatures that find their skull or limb under the weight of a basalt slab.
basaltWaterStill: Used for producing drinkable water from the sea. This stone water still, crafted from basalt will take a long time to heat up but will be much more durable to the heat than other rock types.
basaltSundial: A provisional timepiece created using basalt that uses the shadows produced from the sun or moon to tell an approximate time.
basaltBullet: A heavy, rounded piece of basalt, designed to be thrown or slung.
basaltKnife: A basalt knife blade with a wooden grip and handle to be used for carving, butchering, and other general crafts.
basaltKiln: A kiln formed with large and medium-sized basalt rocks. This arrangement will be great for firing clay items.
basaltPickaxe: A pickaxe using a curved piece of basalt as its head, ready to crush, break and pulverize other stones, rocks, and ore.
basaltHoe: A great tool for gardening; used for tilling the ground. This hoe is crafted using durable, but heavy basalt.
basaltSandCastFlask: Essentially, a stone box filled with green sand used for casting metal objects and a bit excessive with its use of basalt.
basaltWell: A well constructed using basalt columns, a likely appropriate use for their long, protruding shape.
woodenTrackGate: A wooden gate that is built to fit over tracks, allowing you safe passage and blocking other unwanted "guests".
moldyScroll: A dampened bound scroll that has seen better days. The smell of mold and earth is emitted as you hold it, uncertain if it may just fall apart.
mysteriousParchment: This parchment is strangely soft and almost velvety given what it was made from. You feel compelled to scrawl on it.
magicalInscription: A parchment containing the crude drawings, notes, and diagrams concerning magical properties.
cattailLeaves: Long hairless strands of leaves from the cattail plant.
cattailShoots: Tender, edible shoots squeezed and cut out from the bottom of a cattail plant.
cattailFlowers: A couple cattail flowers, known for their unique look and cottony mass that is contained within.
cattailSeeds: The seeds from inside cattail flowers, de-fluffed and ready to grow.
cobblestoneFlooring: 用各种形状和颜色的小石头铺设的好似鹅卵石一般的地板.
waterLilies: A mass of water lily pads, plucked from a swamp from their roots. Although likely unpalatable, they may be edible in a pinch.
mud: A loamy pile of wet soil. It smells of earth and is quite of a burden to carry around.
spikerushSheaths: Strong, woody sheaths from the spikerush plant, a type of grass primarily found in wetlands.
spikerushSeeds: The seeds from the distinctive fibrous flowering bud of the spikerush plant.

itemGroup.containerOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: 装有未净化的水的容器
itemGroup.coconutContainerOfPotableWater: 装有饮用水的椰子容器

joinServerRetryReason.unableToJoinSteamLobby: 无法加入 Steam 游戏大厅. 请检查你的互联网连接并确认已连接到 Steam.
joinServerRetryReason.unableToConnectToGlobalMatchmakingServer: 无法连接到 [global matchmaking] 服务器.
joinServerRetryReason.unableToConnectToDedicatedMatchmakingSer:
无法连接到专用服务器. 服务器所有者应确保中继端口为 38740.

如需更多信息请查阅 {(https://www.waywardgame.com/multiplayer):multiplayer page} .
joinServerRetryReason.webRTCTimeout:
WebRTC 超时.
该错误可能由多种网络问题导致. 服务器所有者可尝试使用中继端口 38740 以解决此问题.

如需更多信息请查阅 {(https://www.waywardgame.com/multiplayer): multiplayer page} .

gameLostGLContext:
调用 GPU 时发生问题. 游戏将会尝试自动恢复.

如果恢复失败，请保存并尝试手动重启游戏.
gameMultiplayerSynchronizing: 与服务器同步游戏数据.
loading.menuCustomGameOptionsImporting: 正在导入自定义游戏设置...
loading.menuOptionsImportingGlobalData: 正在替换非世界部分的存档数据...
multiplayerWaitingForGameData: 等待游戏数据开始传输

attack: 它能使你的攻击比预想的更为猛烈.
defense: 它能使你的四周被守护灵光所环绕.
illumination: 令人惊叹的光辉点亮原野.
weightCapacity: 坚固又宽敞... 它远比外表看起来更能装.
itemWeight: 即便是同等的材料，也能奇妙地拥有更轻的重量.
skill: 似乎提高了你在 {0} 上的经验.
reputation: 一些反常的哼唱通过接触与你共鸣.
range: 柔软又牢固, 可以使你比正常射的更远.
useBenefits: 比预期的更多, 更庞大, 也更丰厚.
trapDamage: 比寻常的陷阱造成更高的伤害.
maxWeight: 持有它的时候你感觉更轻快了，提高你的最大负重.
containerWeight: 放入其中的物品莫名变轻了.
preservationRate: 一种特殊的材料覆于此上，使其中保存的物品呈现一种异常新鲜的状态.
stokeValue: 惊异的易燃性，但又奇妙的保持了高温.
insulation: 倘若从这里穿越到另一个世界，这东西与外界的隔绝就显现得更清楚了(注: 隔绝原词 insulation 也作绝缘之义).
throwingBonus: 出人意料却又无可否认的绝佳投掷物.
offering: 即便暗中标上了休战的价码，也是喜欢它的生物无法拒绝的诱惑.
craftingBonus: 当用作制造材料时，它仿佛在发光.
itemRegeneration: 随着时间的推移，磨损的表面又隐约焕发出了光泽.
civilizationBonus: 一个帮助人类取代自然的卓越建构.
growingSpeed: 植物或菌类栖息生长的完美土壤.

message.aboutHours: 你似乎花了大约 {1} {2} 来进行 {0}.
message.absorbNotPossible: 你无法对没有魔法属性的物品进行汲取.
message.actionAlterAltered: {0} 的一个魔法属性已经被转变了!
message.actionAlterFailed: 你转魔 {0} 的尝试失败了.
message.actionAlterNotPossible: 你无法对没有可转换魔法属性的物品进行转魔.
message.actionAttachContainerAttachedContainer: 你把 {0} 安装到了 {1} 上.
message.actionAttachContainerCannotAttach: 你无法把 {0} 安装到蒸馏器上.
message.actionAttachContainerNothingToAttachCont: 这里没有能够安装 {0} 的设备.
message.actionAttackNoHandsSelected: 你还没有选择用哪只手进攻.
message.actionButcherReleasesLava: 岩浆从 {0} 的内脏中喷射而出.
message.actionCastAreaOverfished: 这地方的鱼都被捞光了.
message.actionCraftYouLackTheRequirements: 你不满足制造它的条件.
message.actionDetachContainerDetachContainer: 你把 {0} 从 {1} 上取了下来.

crafter: 你制作的物品会拥有额外的耐久，但制作难度也会增加.
gardener: 种植 50 个植物或蘑菇.
gatherer: 起始掌握一定砍伐和采矿技艺，但是它们成长的速度会变慢.
hunter: 生物会对你造成更少伤害，但是提高它们的生命值.
locksmith: 起始掌握较高的开锁技艺. 撬锁成功时吸引敌对生物注意的概率变得更高.

幽灵海盗也会于通常无法到达的地点生成.
thrower: 投掷会造成额外的伤害，但是技艺成长的速度会变慢.
trapper: 使用陷阱对 10 个生物造成伤害.
陷阱会造成额外的伤害，但是技艺成长的速度会变慢.
treasureHunter: 起始携带一张破碎的地图.
collector: 起始携带一个完全随机的物品. 移除所有的默认起始物品.
explorer: 曾经经过或收集到所有种类的地格.
grandmaster: 起始额外掌握两项技艺. 技艺成长的速度会变慢.
prepared: 在每个装备位上都装备了东西.
起始额外携带一件装备.

起始额外携带一个治疗物品.

起始携带一个金质六分仪.

起始携带一条木筏，但是会变得更饿更渴.
dragonSlayer: 不再生成变异幼龙，幼龙会更频繁地喷火.
treasurer: 起始携带一件高阶装备. 起始拥有 32,000 怨恶声誉.
pulchritudinous: 在每个装备位上都装备了魔法物品.
起始额外携带一件魔法装备.
malevolent: 起始拥有 8000 怨恶声誉. 仁善声誉以 2x 速度增长.
benevolent: 起始拥有 8000 仁善声誉. 怨恶声誉以 2x 速度增长.
boundless: 起始额外掌握三项技艺. 技艺成长的速度会变慢.
talented: 所有技艺进度总和达到 1000%.
起始额外掌握一项技艺. 技艺成长的速度会变慢.
pacifier: 驯服过所有种类的可驯服生物.
起始驯服一只变异生物.
merchant: 游商提供一点折扣，但是售卖的东西会变得更少.
notekeeper: 起始携带一本书、一张纸和一根墨.
operator: 所有技艺初始拥有 5% 进度.
huntsman: 击杀过所有种类的生物.
所有生物都有小概率变得"惊慌失措"

起始携带一条帆船，但会被赋予所有的异常状态.

鬼火也会于通常无法到达的地点生成.
helmsman: 旅行时发现过所有生态的岛屿.
起始携带一条皮质小船, 但是会变得更饿更渴.
multitasker: 每个技艺都使用过至少一次.
所有技艺初始获得 10% 进度. 技艺成长的速度会变慢.
apocryphal: 起始携带一件最多有三个魔法属性的物品.
diverse: 游玩过所有的游戏模式.
所有属性的初始值大幅减少，在属性增长时可以获取双倍的点数.
traitor: 生物被驯服后获得双倍的生命值，但会以两倍速度野化.
masterOfAll: 起始一项技艺掌握至 100%. 无法通过额外加成将技艺进度突破 100%.
rouseabout: 学习 10 张古老的教学卷轴.
制造的成功率轻微提升. 制作配方将只能从古老的教学卷轴学习或则捡起物品来解锁. 古老的教学卷轴起始会携带十张，且有概率从任何生物掉落. 之前已学会配方的进度将被停用.
murderer: 游商会永久停止生成. 起始携带一把铁刀.

modLoadError.modRequiresItself: 模组依赖本身才能运行
modLoadError.localModPrecedence: 已在本地模组中安装，优先使用该模组的本地安装版本
modLoadError.incompatibleVersion: 与当前游戏版本不兼容
modLoadError.serverSideOnNonDedicatedServer: 服务端模组只能在服务器版本中启用

multiplayerDisconnectReason.banned: 你已被禁止进入该服务器
multiplayerDisconnectReason.desync: 你的游戏与服务器数据不同步

dynamic: 按所处环境播放最合适的曲目.

backToCivilization:
在找到所有的宝物后，我发现我终于能从岛上离开了. 我带着它们乘着帆船追溯来时的痕迹，从岛上回到了我曾经称之为家乡的小村子.

起先我是快乐的. 我带回的财宝使我富有，并拥有了我曾经想要的一切. 好景不长，一切都慢慢变得单调起来. 

我再也无法把这个村子当成 "家乡" 了.

群岛在召唤着我归去. 虽然在岛上我是在艰难挣扎，但实际上我不仅活下来了，还逐渐过得兴盛起来. 就算直到如今，那也是一种令人怀念的刺激的，渴望着更多财宝的感觉. 以他们的愤怒为代价，开发那些岛屿赢取那些财富.

为什么没有人听说过这些地方，难道说这也是神秘的一部分? 这些岛屿的居民永生都不会离开，即使那些曾经离去的...最终也总会回来. 我也如此. 不需要别的选择了.

说到底，从未有人真正离开过这个岛.
bleeding: {0?{0}:徒手去 {1}} 割伤了我. 如果不对伤口进行包扎，处境会很快变得更加严峻. 更多伤口可能会导致更严重的流血. 我必须用绷带、止血带或缝合线来止血. 我开始感到有点晕眩了…
burned: 我身上被火撩过的地方还残留着疼痛. 我知道当处在这持续的疼痛中时，我的注意力和幸福感都会下降. 尝试缓和这种痛苦才是明智之举. 或许在烧伤处浇上液体可以缓解这疼痛，更明智的主意还是游泳来利用水中的矿物质治愈伤口.
caving:
在外面的时候，我能听到鸟类和小动物的叫嚷，来自海面的风声，偶尔还有远处传来的咆哮或者捕猎者在灌木丛中追逐猎物的声音.

等下到地底深处，情况就大不相同了. 岛的深处非常安静. 且不同于地表，这些罕有所闻的声音让我 {/实在是/} 浑身发颤. 有微弱的滴答声，像远处在滴水；有空气流过石缝发出的微弱响声；还有间歇的咔哒声，对此我只能认为它可能是大型节肢动物的爪子发出的声音.

这洞穴里绝对有什么 {/东西/}. 和岛上一样洞穴里也有人类活动的迹象，没准儿就有宝藏呢. 只是，这样的想法并不能使我克服对那深远幽暗的畏惧.
combat:
当我激怒了 {0} 并与之陷入缠斗的时候，我意识到以我现在的水平并不适合这样做. 我脑海中始终纠结着是要 {/"战斗"/} 还是 {/"逃跑"/}. 也许逃离 {0} 才是更优选择. 我也想过尝试驯服或喂它点什么来摆脱现在的囧况.

如果这些手段都失败了，那就只能通过暴力快速了结对方来保护我自己. 我将努力记下那些特定生物的弱点. 举个例子，{0} {1?:不}抵抗{1?{1}:任何}种类的伤害，{2?但是弱于 {2}:且没有任何弱点}. 这一点同样也适用于我自己的衣甲.

以往的经验证明了格挡是很有用的，它可以阻挡对手的进攻. 只要我双手都拿上武器或者有一只手架好盾牌，我就可以用这种方式来减轻敌人所能造成的伤害.
corpse: 躺在那的 {0} 已经死去多时了. 为了维持我自己的生命，也许我可以用锋利的工具或材料来切割{1?这些:这具}尸体并采集点有用的东西.
creatureTaming:
当我见证了 {0} 的死亡时，我突然回想起曾经那纯真的日子. 当我开始考虑要善待这里的生物时，我想起了那句 {/"暴力无法解决问题"/} 的俗语.

我应该可以尝试用我的技艺驯服生物，但是给它们喂点喜欢的食物可能是个更好的主意. 这两种选择都需要接近它们，也许我还可以简单地把东西放在它们的必经之路上，看看他们拿取后是否会对我更友善. 我想随着技艺的熟练，这几种行动都将变得更加容易成功.
dehydration: 水，水，无处不在，却无可尝饮

我不断地想起那句诗. {/水，水.../} 我的意识逐渐迷蒙了；我的嘴巴皲裂了. 只有得到它我才能坚持下去.

不幸的是，与我而言最唾手可得的水却是几乎无法直接饮用的. 我得做个蒸馏器把海水淡化一下...这是我现在应当去努力的方向.

如果我足够幸运，我也能在岛的内部或洞穴下找到淡水水源. 这些应该是能直接饮用的，不过不怕一万只怕万一，为了安全起见最好也先煮沸再喝.
durability:
我的 {0} 快要被用坏了. {1?我应该能用 {1} 轻松地修好它:如果有合适的资源，我就能做把锤子来修理它}.

假如我寻找制造材料的时候更积极一点，或者技艺更高超一些，我就能用高品质的材料来打造出更耐用的工具、盔甲或武器了. {2?不过我也可以制造点加固剂来:如果我找到了调和加固剂的办法，也可以通过}加固以作补救，这样也能让物品的耐久大大提高.
encumbered:
我带的东西太重了! 我需要清理一下背包里那堆沉重的物品来减少我的负担. 像这样携带太多物品会减缓我的行动，并严重消耗了我的体力.

我行李里那些最沉的东西是 {0}，{1} 和 {2}.
failureInCrafting:
我制作{0}的尝试失败了，主要因为我在{1}方面匮乏的技艺或知识. 我相信通过反复尝试，我能够变得更为熟练并使技艺得到成长，最终取得成功. 我也希望这些材料能承受住我拙劣操作所带来的磨损，不然我就得更换那些尝试过程中损坏的部件了.

尽管我有很多制造新东西的点子，但有些主意在我的技艺水平达到更高前是很难实现的.
gardening:
在我忙于 {0} 时，我也在观察思索我所种下植物的生长. 尽管多数植物在大约开花时就能产生有价值的资源了，但据我观察大多情况下成熟期，也就是水果和蔬菜成熟且能采集到种子后，进行收割才是最划算的.

如果我想做的更好，我可能还需要考虑为我的园地制作肥料或换上肥沃的土壤. 土壤质量也会影响我种下的作物的成长. 同样，浇水更不该被遗忘. 灌溉能实打实地帮助它们成长并存活得更久，这样才有机会在这个可怕的环境下生产出资源来.
healthIssues:
我正处于有史以来最差的状态，浑身伤痕累累，就快要撑不住了. 我需要医疗，休息和安全的食物，最好三者皆有，这样才能有所转机.

{0?尽管很难舍弃，但把衣服拆了做成绷带对我现在的困境来说似乎是个不错的选择.}{1?幸运的是，我的行李中还有 {1} 可以用来治疗.}
inedible: 吃掉 {0} 大概不是个好主意. 我 {1?想我可能:应该是幸运地没有} 因此中毒{1?了}... 最好还是留意下我准备要吃的东西. 像这样的玩意儿不到万不得还是不吃为妙.
itemQualities: 当我拿起 {0} 时, 我意识到这个样品的确是 {Misc:ColorizeQuality:({1},{ARTICLE:{2}})} 的. 我确定用它制造物品能极大提升成品的品质. 我还发现它看起来比同类物品更结实，这使得用它做出的成品也会变得更加耐用.
mercantile:
今天我遇到 {0} 了，一个同我处于相似境地，在这岛上挣扎求存的人. 他们看起来很友善并且愿意与我交换他们物资.

我的交易技艺能喂我带来更好的价格. 我们约定了一套以点券命名的货币系统，当我给 {0} 物品时就能得到点券，反之则需要支付.

尽管我找到了这个值得交易的伙伴，我的脑海中还是浮现了一些邪恶的想法. 强行拿走他们的物资将会使我和岛上的他人互相对立，但也许为了他们的财物和装备也是值得的?
nightfall: 黄昏很快就要到来了. 谁知道黑暗中潜伏着什么 —— 找个避难所或者搭个营地来过夜才是明智之举.
poisoned: 当我写下这一句时，我的视力已经开始模糊了，肠胃也像是打了个结. {0} 让我中了毒. 就算在这书写的过程中我能都感到自己在变得越来越虚弱. 饥渴感在吞噬我，我的健康也早就完蛋了. 我必须试着做出点能解毒的东西. 也许带有药性的植物可以帮助我摆脱这场混乱.
reputation:
随着时间的推移以及我求生斗争的持续，我曾做过的那些同岛的利益相背的事情似乎开始产生什么影响.

当我播种植物，或者善待岛上的原住民时，这种隐约的敌意就会减少. 同样，当我采集资源、破坏植被或攻击生物时，充满敌意的野兽就出现得更频繁了.

当我写下这些的时候，这个岛似乎是充斥着 {0?{#--COLOR-GOOD:友善}:{#--COLOR-BAD:恶意}} 的. 为使我得生存简单一点，可能要考虑限制对自然环境造成伤害了.
seaTravel:
我终究还是做到了!

{0?我乘着 {0} 穿越风浪冲向这一组新的岛屿.:我以往在游泳上付出的努力使我得以抵达这一组新的岛屿.} {1>0?{2=0?使用 {1...}, 我能大大地加快我的旅程，并随之减少期间食水的消耗.:使用 {1...}, 我能节约一些旅行所需的时间，而 {2...} 还能在这一基础上进一步加速，食水的消耗也因此大幅减少了.}:如果我有{2...}，我就能大大缩短航程所需的时间，并为旅途节省许多食水. 没有它们在海上航行是很困难的.}
staminaReplenishment: 我的呼吸变得愈加急切和沉重. 我已经工作到快要力竭了. 我必须只进行必要的工作以回复我的体能. 当然更有效的办法是在地上小憩一会，或者干脆打开铺盖睡一觉来充分放松. 休息对我的身心健康还是很重要的.
starvation:
每一步我都感觉越发虚弱，就像是在走向死亡.

我现在什么东西都能吃得下去. 是的，就算是那些这辈子都没想过可以入口的玩意也行. 我能吃得下发现的那些老鼠内脏，树枝苦种，甚至是令人毛骨悚然的小爬虫. 只要能在这荒岛上吃点东西什么行.

去远点的地方找找甚至是自己种点庄稼估计是个好主意，毕竟我也不知道得在这待多久. 如果我就这么饿下去，大概就活不了多久了.
stranded:
醒来后我发现我并不在海船上，我的同伴们也不见了. 我穿的衣服已经变得破破烂烂，身上的物品也只剩下了 {0}，以及一点其他玩意.

宝藏...这个词在我的脑海中一闪而逝，但...我应该是记得些关于宝藏的事情的.
toolUse: 工欲善其事，必先利其器

当我试着徒手 {0} 时，我想起了这句古语. 我知道用工具来 {1} 能降低受伤的可能，也会为更高效.

此外，我发现用带刃的工具伐木，或者用钝器采矿时效率都有所提升. 真是古之人不余欺也.
treasureHunting:
我偶然间发现了一张破烂的地图，并且在仔细看过上面的图案后，发现了一个标记的位置. 这很可能是张藏宝图. 基于周围的环境来定位可能要花点时间，但是我想我还是需要之后尝试调查它的. 随着我测绘技艺的提升，我确信我能破解出更多内容. 

尽管只是一瞬间，我确实重新唤起了我对宝藏的狂热.

blacksmithing:
- 影响相关制作的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 修理/加固/精炼 金属物品的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
botany:
- 降低站在植物上方时践踏损伤它们的概率.
 - 提高对植物 采集/收获 的成功率.
 - 提高对树和植物 采集/收获 时所得物资的品质.
 - 降低对植物 采集/收获 时消耗体力的概率.
 - 降低对植物 采集/收获 时损伤它们的概率.
 - 减少种子发芽耗时.
 - 增加每次 采集/收获 所得物资的数量.
 - 提高食用植物的效果.
 - 提高 封贮/精炼 植物类物品的成功率.
camping:
- 使用睡袋时可以睡得更久.
 - 提高生火的成功率.
 - 提高用日晷测时的准确度.
 - 增加灭火的效率.
 - 提高给火把添火的成功率.
cartography:
- 增加挖掘或打捞宝藏的范围.
 - 增加破损或描摹的地图的清晰度，使你在使用损坏或不准确的地图时辨认出更多有效信息.
 - 提高描摹及绘制地图的成功率.
 - 增加你绘制的准确度.
 - 减少你描摹地图时的失真.
 - 增加你绘制的半径.
 - 在技艺达到中阶后，揭示藏宝图所属的岛屿.
claythrowing:
- 影响相关制作的良品率和成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
cooking:
- 在使用相关技艺进行制作时，提高你的良品率和成功率.
 - 影响烹制食品的耐腐程度.
 - 提高食用已烹制食物的效果.
 - 提高 封贮/精炼 烹制食品的成功率.
 - 在烹制食物时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
fishing:
- 提高捕鱼的成功率. 在使用钓鱼竿时还会增加最大抛投范围.
 - 提高没有钓饵捕鱼的成功率.
fletching:
- 在使用相关技艺进行制作时，提高你的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 修理/加固/精炼 相关物品的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
glassblowing:
- 影响相关制作的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 加固/精炼 相关物品的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
leatherworking:
- 影响相关制作的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 修理/加固/精炼 皮质物品的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
lockpicking:
- 提高撬锁的成功率.
 - 在使用相关技艺进行制作时，提高你的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 修理/加固/精炼 撬锁工具的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
lumberjacking:
- 提高从树上采集资源的成功率.
 - 提高从树上采集时所得物资的品质.
 - 降低伐木时消耗体力的概率.
 - 增加每次所得物资的数量.
mining:
- 提高 采掘/挖掘 的成功率.
 - 降低 采掘/挖掘 时消耗体力的概率.
 - 提高从石头中采得物资的品质.
 - 增加每次所得物资的数量.
mycology:
- 降低站在蘑菇上方时践踏损伤它们的概率.
 - 提高对蘑菇 采集/收获 的成功率.
 - 提高对蘑菇 采集/收获 时所得物资的品质.
 - 降低对蘑菇 采集/收获 时消耗体力的概率.
 - 降低对蘑菇 采集/收获 时损伤它们的概率.
 - 减少孢子发芽耗时.
 - 增加每次 采集/收获 所得物资的数量.
 - 提高食用蘑菇的效果.
 - 提高 封贮/精炼 蘑菇的成功率.
parrying:
- 当你在双手中都装备了物品后，增加你的基础防御值.
 - 提高战斗中格挡伤害的成功率.
 - 降低被攻击消耗体力的概率.
stonecrafting:
- 影响相关制作的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 修理/加固/精炼 石质物品的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
swimming:
- 提高在水中行走的速度.
 - 降低游泳消耗体力的概率.
 - 在技艺更娴熟后，能够搏风斗浪，从而直接游到其他岛屿上.
tactics:
- 增加你的基础攻击值.
 - 提高攻击命中率.
 - 降低进攻时消耗体力的概率.
 - 增加射击或投掷造成的伤害.
tailoring:
- 影响相关制作的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 修理/加固/精炼 织物的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
throwing: - 增加射击或投掷时所能造成的伤害、命中率以及最大射程.
tinkering:
- 影响相关制作的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 修理/加固/精炼 各类杂物的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
trapping:
- 增加使用陷阱捕获生物的成功率，以及所造成的伤害.
 - 降低触发陷阱的概率以及受到的陷阱造成的伤害.
woodworking:
- 影响相关制作的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高 修理/加固/精炼 木质物品的成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
taming:
- 提高驯化的成功率.
 - 提高驯服效果持续的时间.
 - 降低 驯化/赠予/挤奶/拴系/抚摸 时消耗体力的概率.
 - 降低挤奶时减少的幸福度.
 - 提高赠予变异生物物品时驯化的成功率.
 - 提高索系变异生物或未驯服生物时的成功率.
 - 提高抚摸的效果(使它们变得更幸福等).
gardening:
- 增加种植的植物或蘑菇的耐久度(即生命值).
 - 降低种植(植物或蘑菇)时它们的成长耗时.
 - 提高开垦成功率.
 - 降低开垦时消耗体力的概率.
 - 在使用相关技艺进行制作时，提高你的良品率和成功率.
 - 提高相关物品的精炼成功率.
 - 在进行相关制作时，你会逐渐觉察一些制作效能的相关信息.
bartering: - 影响交易物品时所能获得的点券数量.
seafaring:
- 允许在一次旅行中抵达更远的岛屿.
 - 降低划桨造成的体能负担.
 - 降低在岛屿间旅行时所消耗的时间，从而减少航行中的饥渴、船只损伤以及物品的腐坏.
thaumaturgy:
- 提高 异化/附魔/升格/转魔 的成功率.
 - 降低 异化/附魔/升格/转魔 时消耗体力的概率.
dualWielding:
- 增加副手武器造成的额外伤害.
 - 降低双持时额外消耗体力的概率.

birdDroppings: 某些飞行动物产生的粪便.
animalDung: 一堆气味浓郁的某些动物产生的新鲜粪便.
guano: 蝙蝠的排泄物，非常适合用作肥料.
wispDust: 一小堆从鬼火上脱离的粉尘，会在世间飞速消失.
acid: 闪着荧光的绿色浓浆咕噜咕噜渗入地面.

ui.menuAboutDescription: 了解更多 Wayward 背后的故事.
ui.menuAboutGameDescription: Wayward 是一部具有挑战性的、自顶向下的、回合制生存类Roguelike游戏. 探索、建造并在这片无情的岛屿上努力生存下去.
ui.menuAboutTextSpecialThanksTestorsAndDona: 在此额外感谢所有早期测试玩家、赞助者以及其他支持者.

ui.menuCustomGameOptionsItemDurabilityToolt: 缩放调整全部物品拥有的耐久值.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsItemDecayTooltip: 缩放调整全部物品拥有的腐坏值(影响如食物的可保存时间).

ui.menuOptionsButtonImportGlobalSaveData: 导入非世界部分的存档数据

ui.menuOptionsButtonSaveDataClearOptions: 将所有设置选项恢复为默认值

在日志路径下记录性能跟踪文件. 在调试解决性能问题时非常有用.
注意: 这些记录文件的大小可能会飞速增加. 不建议长时间开启.

ui.menuOptionsHeadingTooltipsTile: 地格浮动信息显示选项
ui.menuOptionsTooltipTurnDelay: 在转换方向或经过回合后，接受移动指令的延迟时间.
ui.menuOptionsTooltipMouseTurnDelay: 使用鼠标时，在转换方向或经过回合后，接受移动指令的延迟时间.
ui.menuOptionsTooltipUiScaleClamped: Currently clamped to {#--TEXT-SECONDARY:{0}} by the viewport resolution.

查找按键已绑定的操作.
你可以使用 {#--TEXT-SECONDARY:({#--COLOR-BIND:,})} 分隔以同时选择多项.
或者在前方添加 {#--TEXT-SECONDARY:({#--COLOR-BIND:!})} 来检索未使用某按键的操作.
ui.menuOptionsBindChoose: 键入替换现有的绑定按键.
ui.menuOptionsBindChooseAdd: 键入额外增加的绑定按键.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAllowAlternatingDirecti: 勾选后，当按下两个方向或者鼠标在人物斜角方向按下时你将在两个方向间交替移动.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAlwaysShowMoreInformati: 勾选后，你就不用按住按键来显示浮动提示中的更多信息.
ui.menuOptionsButtonEnableLowPowerModeToolt: 勾选后，游戏会尝试使用更少的系统资源.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableAcrylicTranspare: 勾选后，透明组件（如提示信息面板、对话框及中断菜单）将不再对其遮盖的部分进行模糊处理，在某些设备上可能降低 CPU 或 GPU 负载.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableOverlaySupportTo: 勾选后，Overlay 支持会被禁用以降低GPU负载, 但是禁用后 Steam Overlay 将无法正常运行.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableUIEffectsTooltip: 勾选后，动画等 UI 特效会被禁用，在某些设备上可能降低 CPU 或 GPU 负载.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableUIOpacityTooltip: 勾选后，UI 组件的透明度会被禁用，在某些设备上可能降低 CPU 或 GPU 负载.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableMovementAnimatio: 勾选后，移动动画会被禁用，在某些设备上可能降低 CPU 或 GPU 负载.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAutoAttackTooltip: 勾选后，你在朝生物（启用PVP时也会包括玩家）移动时会自动使用你设定的手上的物品攻击对方.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAutoPickUpTooltip: 勾选后，将在移动到物品上方时自动拾取.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAutoPickUpOnIdleTooltip: 勾选后，将在空闲时自动拾取角色脚下的物品.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropOnDismantleTooltip: 勾选后，在分解物品时，将自动把物品丢弃在角色脚下.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableCraftingProtecte: 禁止在制作时使用被锁定的需求物品
勾选后，被锁定的物品将彻底不参与制作过程. 无论该选项是否勾选，会被消耗的物品都不会参与制作过程.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropOnGatherHarvest: 砍伐/采掘/收获/挖掘时丢下物品
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropOnGatherHarvestTool: 勾选后，你将把砍伐/采掘/收获/挖掘获得的物品自动丢到你控制角色的脚下.
ui.menuOptionsButtonKeepSortActiveTooltip: 勾选后，你的物品栏将会在你获得新物品时自动排序.
ui.menuOptionsButtonUseAdjacentContainersTo: 勾选后，在执行制造或其他行动时，会自动使用附近容器中或地格上的物品.
ui.menuOptionsButtonHideEquippedHeadgearToo: 勾选后，你的角色所装备的头部防具将不会显示.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAutoSaveTooltip: 启用后，你的游戏将定时存档以防数据丢失.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropIntoContainersToolt: 勾选后，当面对容器执行丢下操作时，物品将会尽可能丢进容器中，而非直接丢到地上.
ui.menuOptionsButtonWarnOnDangerousActionsT: 勾选后，当你将要踩到会伤害你的东西时，会进行二次确认.
ui.menuOptionsButtonWarnWhenBreakingItemsOn: 勾选后，在你制造/分解时，如果该操作失败会使物品完全摧毁，则会进行二次确认.
勾选后，在你使用已经破损的物品时会进行二次确认，该行动可能会完全摧毁使用的物品.
ui.menuOptionsHeadingWarnWhenBreakingItems: 使用破损物品时进行警告
ui.menuOptionsButtonSaveDataClearBindings: 重置所有绑定按键为默认状态
ui.menuOptionsTooltipDialogOpacity: 控制游戏内各类面板的透明度.
ui.menuOptionsDeveloperUIExperimentsDescrip: 新的开发中的 UI 功能. 启用会存在一定风险 — 这些实验性功能可能会引发灾难性的错误! 请确保你完全理解启用的后果再开启该选项.
ui.menuOptionsButtonSaveCompressionTooltip: 通过压缩存档最多可以减少 80% 的存档数据大小，但是会增加保存或加载存档所需要消耗的时间. 建议在希望限制存档占用空间时开启.
ui.menuPauseTooltipNotPaused: 多人模式下，仅在主机选择暂停时，游戏中时间才会停止流逝.
ui.menuPauseParagraphDedicatedServer: 服务器已启动，游戏正在运行.
ui.menuModesDescription: 配置此存档限定的游戏设置.
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsDescription: 修改多人游戏相关设置.
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsOpenServerDescript: 勾选以允许玩家加入你的游戏.
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsCopyGameCodeToolti: 将 Game Code 复制到剪贴板，并分享给你的朋友来一起游玩!
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsCheckConnectionPar: 检查你的网络是否配置正确. 访问 Wayward 官方网站的 {(https://www.waywardgame.com/multiplayer):multiplayer page} 页面以获取更多信息. 以下几项检查中只要有一项显示为 {#--COLOR-GOOD:OK} 多人模式即可正常运行.
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsCheckConnectionRes: {#--COLOR-BAD:无法验证与 Steam Relay Network 的连接状态}.
{#--COLOR-BAD:无法建立 WebRTC 连接. 连接可能被防火墙或路由器阻拦. 如果 WebSocket 连接正常玩家仍然能够加入你的游戏}.
{#--COLOR-BAD:无法验证 端口 {0} 是否可用}.
ui.menuJoinServerDescription: 加入一个多人游玩的服务器.
ui.menuJoinServerInputPlaceholder: Game Code, IP Address, or Hostname
ui.menuJoinServerChooseModifiersDescription: Enable and disable benefits and challenges.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypeFrie: 你可以邀请任意玩家加入游戏；游戏将会对好友可见，他们无需邀请也可自由加入.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypePubl: 游戏将会对所有人可见，且可以自由加入服务器.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypePriv: 仅有受到邀请的玩家才能加入游戏.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceAllowTravelin: 允许玩家旅行到其他岛屿.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceAllowHardcore: 允许玩家在 "硬核模式"中，死亡时以新角色重生.
ui.menuSharedRealTimeTickSpeedTooltip: 实时模式下每个 [Tick] 所间隔的现实时间.
ui.menuSharedMaxTravelTimeLabelTooltip: 旅行至另一个岛屿时消耗的最大回合数.
